oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Craigmiles Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Craigmiles Building. Saloon to the left. Giant coffee pot suspended from the exterior of the building. Apartments were upstairs. Hardware store to the right. Black man with his pushcart. The building is located off of Ocoee Street.
Craigmiles Hall was built in 1878 as an Opera House and Meeting Hall. Built by Walter Craigmiles on the Town Square in Cleveland, Tennessee, it was once the social center of the city.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hardware stores; Stores & shops; Storefronts; Carts & wagons; Coffeepots; Bars; Buildings
